result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D Smith

records.addlTxt: 11:40 AM Defendant Matthew D Smith not in court.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Matthew D Smith.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Matter set for a PH. Attorney Osberg did attempt to contact her client.  There has been an offer in this matter.   Attorney Osberg requested an adjournment to allow her time to meet with her client as to the State's offer.  State requested a warrant.   Court issued BW based upon DE being in court prior and receiving this court date.  Court issued BW with a $1000 cash bond, adjacent states, stayed warrant until Friday, 11/4/22.  If contact is made with DE prior to Friday, a court date will be given.  Ad. 11:43 AM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with S.M.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.

1:03 PM Defendant Matthew D Smith in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Atty Laurie Osberg appears with DE.   Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Quash the warrant.  Waive formal reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for  PH.  Court instructs on waiver of TL, DE understands waiver of TL, court accepts waiver.  Set for PH. .State asking for a $3000.00 sign bond, absolute sobriety, no contact with SM.   DE may get his DL back. 

$3000.00 sign bond, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician, any prescribed medications will be taken as directed only. No contact with S.M.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:48 PM Defendant Matthew D Smith not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court will order a $1000.00 cash warrant stayed until friday noon.

1:15 PM Defendant Matthew D Smith appeared by video.   ADA Emily Nelson appeared in person.  Attorney Laurie Osberg appeared in person.  Matter set for bail/bond hearing.    State argued for a $2500 signature bond with conditions Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.   Attorney Osberg made an argument regarding bond conditions.  Attorney Barna will remain on the case until a substitution is requested.  Court ordered $2500 signature bond with conditions as recommended by the State plus the additional condition Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege. INIT set for 9/27/22 at 1:00 PM.   DE instructed to call PD office by tomorrow.   Adj. 1:20 PM.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege.
